info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 3:54PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT WEST CENTRAL NICHOLAS...EAST CENTRAL KANAWHA...SOUTHWESTERN CLAY AND NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 354 PM EST, a snow squall was located near Smithers, or 16 miles northwest of Fayetteville, moving east at 40 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this squall. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Montgomery, Ansted, Cedar Grove, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Hawks Nest State Park, Powellton, Handley, Swiss, Bentree, and Pond Gap. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 19 and 21. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this squall. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
